channel.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
channel.description: Each time I start up my second world for my game, it will last 1-15 minutes or so and either world 1/2 will lose connection to the login server or the login server will crash. Does anyone know what causes this instability to happen?

item.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

VPS running linux = needs more ram assigned per world server and listening server than VPS running windows.

I’m not sure if its the virtualization causing the inflation or if Windows in general handles java more efficiently when it comes to memory use.

500mb of RAM for world server, 500mb of RAM for listening server, 300mb RAM for linux OS and you are already using almost 1.5gb of RAM. Windows Server 2003 - 500 to 600mb OS in RAM, 300mb for LS and world server in RAM. Server 2003 @ 1gb system RAM > Centos 5 @ 1.5 gb RAM imho

Read full topic

item.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

Rofl the regular 18-27$ VPS’s from VPSLand.com are not able to hold more than 50 users in a specific area we had many many client crashes when RSCStake was being ran.

as stated by KO9 earlier he wont be providing help but im sure you can look into it from google or java.sun.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:15, topic:308355”][quote author=pesterd link=topic=404674.msg2996729#msg2996729 date=1255653058]
thats because RSCD unedited is unstable ask KO9 on their fix of having 300+ in a specific section on the map Im sure he can point you in the right direction but yes, as stated before a proper way to take this would be with more GB of DDR2 Memory(RAM)

That memory leak has to do with Tiles?

and decent desktop for 1,000$ nowadays has generally 500GB Memory + 4-6-8 GB of RAM.

[/quote]
that’s a separate fix, theres another highly unstable bug with RSCD, and it’s a memory leak, 50 players on a day and you would go through 1gb easily. (and crash your server)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

xx c1ph3r xx:

It isn’t a high quality server. I think it has 1GB ram.

You’re probably using up all your RAM then.

I wouldn’t recommend running one RSCD server on anything less than 2GB, ideally 3GB.

Read full topic

item.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

xEnt:

add -Xmx1024m to your LS vm command line arguments

Why?

Our LS isn’t assigned even half of that amount and it processes 10s of thousands of logins per day without ever crashing.

No, it’s more likely that his PC is just completely running out of RAM.

Paste the following:

cat /proc/meminfo

Read full topic

item.title: Two Worlds, One Login Server
item.dc:creator: @Jessekinss Jessekinss
item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 1153376 bytes for Chunk::new. Out of swap space?

There is your problem.

Read full topic

Client config.java

[code]package org.rscdaemon.client.util;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.util.Properties;

public class Config {
/**
* Called to load config settings from the given file
*/
public static void initConfig(String file) throws IOException {
START_TIME = System.currentTimeMillis();

	Properties props = new Properties();
	props.load(new FileInputStream(file));
	
	SERVER_IP = props.getProperty("server");
	SERVER_WORLD = Integer.parseInt(props.getProperty("world"));
	if(SERVER_WORLD == 1) {
		SERVER_PORT = 43594;
	} else if(SERVER_WORLD == 2) {
		SERVER_PORT = 43595;
	} else  {
		System.exit(1);
	}
	CONF_DIR = props.getProperty("config_dir");
	MEDIA_DIR = props.getProperty("media_dir");
	MOVIE_FPS = Integer.parseInt(props.getProperty("movie_fps"));

	props.clear();
}

public static String SERVER_IP, CONF_DIR, MEDIA_DIR;
public static int SERVER_PORT, SERVER_WORLD, MOVIE_FPS;
public static long START_TIME;

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:
@xx_c1ph3r_xx wrote:

Each time I start up my second world for my game, it will last 1-15 minutes or so and either world 1/2 will lose connection to the login server or the login server will crash. Does anyone know what causes this instability to happen?
